x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
Learning and research exist in silos. IT professionals use structured courses, while researchers rely on separate academic platforms. There’s little collaboration or knowledge sharing between these groups. This isolation slows innovation and limits access to valuable insights.
LearnSphere bridges this gap by creating a single platform that brings together learning, research, and collaboration.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

A ServiceNow based app where users can:

  • Access learning modules and research papers in one dashboard

  • Use AI to get personalised recommendations

  • Collaborate on research projects through shared workspaces

  • Publish and track research impact via dashboards and badges

 

ServiceNow products or capabilities will be used for this app:

  • App Engine / Studio

  • Knowledge Management

  • Flow Designer & IntegrationHub

  • Virtual Agent / Now Assist

  • Service Portal / UI Builder

  • Performance Analytics

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Research APIs (CrossRef, Semantic Scholar, arXiv)

  • Knowledge Management, Flow Designer, Virtual Agent

  • IntegrationHub for API connections

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Managing data privacy and publication ownership

  • Handling API rate limits and integration complexity

  • Maintaining user engagement and accessibility
